title: Could the reason why some songs are greyed out on Spotify is because the songs from their owners are copyrighted? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are several possibilities. However none is that the songs are copyrighted, because ALL music on Spotify is copyrighted (and legally licensed to Spotify). That’s why all rightholders get royalties from Spotify, by the way. The reasons can be mainly: they are not licensed to be used in the country you are right now (this is decided by the persons behind the label, or by the artists, not by Spotify).They are files in the personal computer of the curator of a certain playlist. Those songs ARE in the playlist but YOU (or ME) cannot have access to them (because they are private)Juan Maria Solare

All songs are protected by copyright. All of them. So no, that couldn't be why some are grayed out. In the U.S. because of a quirk of copyright law, every single audio recording has copyright until at least 2064. No matter how old.
